result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony S. Lopez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay fine of $150 plus costs.  Bond is to be applied with the balance due within 60 days.

Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date.
Huber for going to work. 
May be served on electronic monitor.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony S. Lopez

Defendant Anthony S. Lopez in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
State files amended information. 
Atty Renc received a copy of the amended information and waives its reading.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
Serve 10 days in jail. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date.
Huber for going to work. 
May be served on electronic monitor. 
Pay fine of $150 plus costs. 
Bond posted is to be applied. Balance to be paid within 60 days.
